sen.j: 大和葛城山（やまとかつらぎさん）は、奈良県御所市と大阪府南河内郡千早赤阪村との境に位置する山。
sen.e: Mt. Yamato Katsuragi is located in the boundary between Gose City, Nara Prefecture and Chihayaakasaka-mura, Minamikawachi District, Osaka Prefecture.
Mt. Yamato Katsuragi is located in the boundary between Gose City, Nara Prefecture and Chihayaakasaka-mura, Minamikawachi District, Osaka Prefecture.
Mt. Yamato Katsuragi is located in the boundary between Gose City, Nara Prefecture and Chihayaakasaka-mura, Minamikawachi District, Osaka Prefecture.
Mt. Yamato Katsuragi has an altitude of 959.2 meters.
Mt. Yamato Katsuragi has an altitude of 959.2 meters.
Mt. Yamato Katsuragi has an altitude of 959.2 meters.

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道沿線の観光地として和泉葛城山よりも知名度が高いため、単に葛城山と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: Since Mt. Yamato Katsuragi is more famous than Mt. Izumi-Katsuragi as a tourist spot on Kinki Nippon Railway, it is sometimes simply referred to as Mt. Katsuragi.
Since Mt. Yamato Katsuragi is more famous than Mt. Izumi-Katsuragi as a tourist spot on the Kinki Nippon Railway, it is sometimes simply referred to as Mt. Katsuragi.
sen.cmt: Kinki Nippon Railway --> the Kinki Nippon Railway
sen.e: Since Mt. Yamato Katsuragi is more famous than Mt. Izumi-Katsuragi as a tourist spot on the Kinki Nippon Railway, it is sometimes simply referred to as Mt. Katsuragi.

sen.j: 金剛生駒紀泉国定公園内にあり、北の二上山 (奈良県・大阪府)、南の金剛山 (金剛山地)とともに連峰をなしている金剛山地の山の一つ。
sen.e: This mountain is located in Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park, and is one of the mountain of Kongo mountainous district which forms a range of mountains with Mt. Nijo in north (Nara Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture) and Kongo-san mountain in south (Kongo mountainous district).

This mountain is located in Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park, and is one of the mountains in Kongo mountainous district which forms a range of mountains together with Mt. Nijo in north (Nara Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture) and Kongo-san mountain in south (Kongo mountainous district).
sen.cmt: and is one of the mountain of Kongo mountainous district --> and is one of the mountains in Kongo mountainous district
sen.e: This mountain is located in Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park, and is one of the mountains in Kongo mountainous district which forms a range of mountains together with Mt. Nijo in north (Nara Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture) and Kongo-san mountain in south (Kongo mountainous district).

sen.j: 山の形状がなだらかであるため、この付近を葛城高原と呼ぶこともある。
sen.e: Shape of the mountains are gentle, therefore, around this area is sometimes called as the Katsuragi highlands.
Shapes of the mountains are gentle, therefore, the area in this neighborhood is sometimes called as the Katsuragi highlands.
sen.cmt: Shape --> Shapes, around this area --> the area in this neighborhood
sen.e: Shapes of the mountains are gentle, therefore, the area in this neighborhood is sometimes called as the Katsuragi highlands.

sen.j: 一般的に利用される登山道は、登山口までの交通の便がよい奈良県御所市から山頂に至る道である。
sen.e: The most commonly used pass up the mountain is the route from Gose City, Nara Prefecture to the mountaintop which is conveniently located in terms of public transportation to get to the starting point for a climb.
The most commonly used pass up the mountain is the route from Gose City, Nara Prefecture to the mountaintop, the starting point of which is conveniently located in terms of public transportation.
The most commonly used pass up the mountain is the route from Gose City, Nara Prefecture to the mountaintop, the starting point of which is conveniently located in terms of public transportation.

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道の近鉄葛城索道線が山麓の登山口から山頂付近を結んでおり、ほぼそのコースに沿っている。
sen.e: The Kintetsu Katsuragi Ropeway Line of Kinki Nippon Railway Company connects the starting point for a climb at the foot of a mountain and around mountaintop, and this route follows almost the same course as the Katsuragi Ropeway Line.

The Kintetsu Katsuragi Ropeway Line of Kinki Nippon Railway Company connects the starting point for a climb at the foot of the mountain and the point near the mountaintop, and this ropeway line follows almost the same course as the route for walking.

The Kintetsu Katsuragi Ropeway Line of Kinki Nippon Railway Company connects the starting point for a climb at the foot of the mountain and the point near the mountaintop, and this ropeway line follows almost the same course as the route for walking.

sen.j: 道中には、櫛羅の滝、行者の滝などの滝がみられる。
sen.e: Water falls such as Kujira no taki (Whale Fall) and Gyoja no taki (Ascetic Waterfall) can be seen while traveling.
Waterfalls such as Kujira no taki (Whale Fall) and Gyoja no taki (Ascetic Waterfall) can be seen while traveling.
Waterfalls such as Kujira no taki (Whale Fall) and Gyoja no taki (Ascetic Waterfall) can be seen while traveling.

sen.j: このほか二上山、金剛山との縦走路がある。
sen.e: Besides, it has the traverse route from Mt. Nijyo to Kongo-san mountain.
Besides, there is a traverse route from Mt. Nijyo to Kongo-san mountain.
sen.cmt: it has the traverse route --> there is a traverse route
sen.e: Besides, there is a traverse route from Mt. Nijyo to Kongo-san mountain.
Azalea
Azalea
Azalea

sen.j: 山頂付近に多数植生しており、5月中旬から下旬ごろに開花。
sen.e: A lot of azaleas are growing gregariously and flower from mid-May to the end of May.
A lot of azaleas grow gregariously near the mountaintop and flower from mid-May to the end of May.
sen.cmt: are growing gregariously --> grow gregariously near the mountaintop
sen.e: A lot of azaleas grow gregariously near the mountaintop and flower from mid-May to the end of May.

Accommodations
Accommodations

sen.j: 山頂付近に葛城高原ロッジが設けられている。
sen.e: Katsuragi Kogen Lodge is established around mountaintop.
Katsuragi Kogen Lodge is provided near the mountaintop.
sen.cmt: established around mountaintop --> provided near the mountaintop
sen.e: Katsuragi Kogen Lodge is provided near the mountaintop.

sen.j: 近鉄御所線近鉄御所駅より奈良交通葛城ロープウェイ前行き乗車、近鉄葛城索道線葛城ロープウェイ前下車。
sen.e: Take the bus bound for Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Katsuragi Ropeway mae from Kintetsu Gosho-line Kintetsu Gosho Station, and get off at Kintetsu the Katsuragi Ropeway Line Katsuragi Ropeway mae.
Take the train bound for "Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Katsuragi Ropeway mae" from Kintetsu Gosho Station of the Kintetsu Gosho-line, and get off at "Kintetsu Katsuragi Ropeway Line Katsuragi Ropeway mae."
